original_content:
message_id: 17ba2f2c2c93113b
subject   : Subject: WITHOUT ENTHUSIASM WE WILL FAIL
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 1 Sep 2021 15:00:24 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Zeal without knowledge is not good; a person who *

*moves to quickly may go the wrong way. *(Pro. 19:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The Bible provides a sound basis for enthusiasm, in

other words (zeal). Paul states it this way, ”*and *

*whatever you do, do it heartedly, as to the Lord.*

(Col. 3:23)—Some people verbalize their inability

to be enthusiastic. I don’t believe there is a person

who hasn’t been enthusiastic about something. A

raise in salary, an award, vacation, promotion, birth

of a child, opportunity, or some other event in life

that creates zeal by its very nature. What we need

in the church is enthusiasm for the mission God has

given His people. This will guarantee peak perfor-

mance.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, keep me from rushing into*

*the unknown. I pray that I would always realize*

*what I am getting into, in my zeal to follow You.*

*Amen. *
original_reflection_text:
The Bible provides a sound basis for enthusiasm, in
other words (zeal). Paul states it this way, ”and whatever you do, do it heatedly, as to the Lord.
(Colossians 3:23)-Some people verbalize their inability
to be enthusiastic. I don’t believe there is a person
who hasn’t been enthusiastic about something. A
raise in salary, an award, vacation, promotion, birth
of a child, opportunity, or some other event in life
that creates zeal by its very nature. What we need
in the church is enthusiasm for the mission God has
given His people. This will guarantee peak perform mance.
original_verse_text: Zeal without knowledge is not good; a person who  moves to quickly may go the wrong way.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, seeking to honor You in all that we do. Help us to approach our work and service with enthusiasm, recognizing that we are ultimately working for You, not for the approval of others. May our zeal for Your mission be evident in our actions, as we strive to be diligent and faithful in all that You have called us to. Guide us, Lord, to use our time and talents with excellence, knowing that our labor is not in vain when it is done for Your glory. Amen.
reflection: The Bible provides a sound basis for enthusiasm, in other words (zeal). Paul states it this way, ”and whatever you do, do it heatedly, as to the Lord. (Colossians 3:23)-Some people verbalize their inability to be enthusiastic. I don’t believe there is a person who hasn’t been enthusiastic about something. A raise in salary, an award, vacation, promotion, birth of a child, opportunity, or some other event in life that creates zeal by its very nature. What we need in the church is enthusiasm for the mission God has given His people. This will guarantee peak perform mance.
subject: Without Enthusiasm We Will Fail

original_content:
message_id: 17ba86d5242ba540
subject   : Subject: THE POSSIBILITIES WITH WISDOM
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 2 Sep 2021 16:32:22 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*To acquire wisdom is to love oneself, people who*

*cherish understanding will prosper. *(Pro. 19:8)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Is it good to love yourself*?* *Yes,* *WHEN *your soul

is at stake! This proverb *does not *condone the self-

centered person who loves and protects his or her

selfish interests and will do anything to serve them.

*Instead* it encourages those who really care about

themselves enough to seek wisdom.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, I pray that You will remove all selfish-*

*self-interests, and replace them with true wisdom.*

*Amen.*
original_reflection_text:
Is it good to love yourself? Yes, WHEN your soul
is at stake! This proverb does not condone the self centered person who loves and protects his or her
selfish interests and will do anything to serve them. Instead it encourages those who really care about
themselves enough to seek wisdom.
original_verse_text: To acquire wisdom is to love oneself, people who  cherish understanding will prosper.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging the wisdom found in Your Word. Help us to truly love ourselves, not in a selfish way, but by seeking the understanding and discernment that comes from You. May we value our souls and make the pursuit of wisdom our highest priority, for it is the foundation of a life well-lived. Guide us, Lord, that we may grow in the knowledge and fear of You. Amen.
reflection: Is it good to love yourself? Yes, when your soul is at stake! This proverb does not condone the self-centered person who loves and protects his or her selfish interests and will do anything to serve them. Instead, it encourages those who really care about themselves enough to seek wisdom.
subject: The Possibilities with Wisdom
verse_text: To acquire wisdom is to love oneself, people who  cherish understanding will prosper.

original_content:
message_id: 17bad309b4401e30
subject   : Subject: THE GIFT OF OBEDIENCE
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 3 Sep 2021 14:44:09 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Keep the commandments and keep your life; despising*

*them leads to death. *(Pro. 19:16)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The commandments we are told to obey are those found

in God’s Word, such as the Ten Commandments (Ex. 20)

and other passages of instruction. To obey what God

teaches in the Bible is self-preserving. To disobey is Self-

destructive.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, instill in me a loving and obedient heart,*

*so that I may inherit the gift of eternal life. **Amen.*
original_reflection_text: The commandments we are told to obey are those found in God’s Word, such as the Ten Commandments (Exodus 20) and other passages of instruction. To obey what God teaches in the Bible is self-preserving. To disobey is Self destructive.
original_verse_text: Keep the commandments and keep your life; despising them leads to death.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that Your commandments are not burdensome, but a path to life and blessing. Help us to heed the wisdom found in Your Word, that we may walk in obedience and experience the fullness of the abundant life You have promised. Give us the strength to resist the temptations of the world and the courage to stand firm in our commitment to You. May our lives reflect the transformative power of Your truth. Amen.
reflection: The commandments we are told to obey are those found in God's Word, such as the Ten Commandments (Exodus 20) and other passages of instruction. To obey what God teaches in the Bible is self-preserving. To disobey is self-destructive.
subject: The Gift of Obedience
verse_text: Keep the commandments and keep your life; despising them leads to death.

original_content:
message_id: 17bb2ae2389d5f28
subject   : Subject: RECEIVE IN FULL MEASURE
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 4 Sep 2021 16:19:22 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*If you help the poor, you are lending to the Lord—*

*and He will repay you! *(Pro. 19:17)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Here God identifies with the poor, as Jesus does

in Mt. 25:31-46. As our Creator, God values all

of us, whether we are poor or rich. When we help

the poor, we honor both the Creator and His crea-

tion. God accepts our help as if we had offered it

directly to Him. Jesus says in Lk. 6:38—"*Give *

*and it shall be given unto you; good measure,*

*pressed down, and shaken together, and running*

*over—*As we see in this verses God returns to

you freely *but* if we give grudgingly we may not

receive the blessings we were expecting.

*Pastor Sather*

*Lord, I pray that I will always give, as freely as*

*I have received from You. **Amen.*
original_reflection_text:
Here God identifies with the poor, as Jesus does
in Matthew 25:31-46. As our Creator, God values all
of us, whether we are poor or rich. When we help
the poor, we honor both the Creator and His crea tion.
God accepts our help as if we had offered it
directly to Him. Jesus says in Luke 6:38-"Give and it shall be given unto you; good measure, pressed down, and shaken together, and running over As we see in this verses God returns to
you freely but if we give grudgingly we may not
receive the blessings we were expecting.
original_verse_text: If you help the poor, you are lending to the Lord- and He will repay you!
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, recognizing that when we care for the poor and the needy, we are honoring You, our Creator. Help us to see the value in all Your children, regardless of their earthly circumstances. May we give freely and joyfully, knowing that our generosity is a reflection of Your own boundless love. As we follow the example of Your Son, Jesus, grant us the wisdom and compassion to be a blessing to those in need. In Your holy name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Here God identifies with the poor, as Jesus does in Matthew 25:31-46. As our Creator, God values all of us, whether we are poor or rich. When we help the poor, we honor both the Creator and His creation. God accepts our help as if we had offered it directly to Him. Jesus says in Luke 6:38, “Give, and it shall be given unto you; good measure, pressed down, and shaken together, and running over.” As we see in this verse, God returns to you freely, but if we give grudgingly, we may not receive the blessings we were expecting.
subject: Receive in Full Measure
verse_text: If you help the poor, you are lending to the Lord- and He will repay you!

original_content:
message_id: 17bb7830fa03f809
subject   : Subject: BENEFICIAL LIFE-STYLE
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 5 Sep 2021 14:50:25 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Fear of the Lord give life, security, and protection *

*from harm. *(Pro. 19:23)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Those who fear the Lord receive “protection from harm,”

because of *their* healthy habits, *their* beneficial life-style,

and sometimes through God’s direction, and intervention.

Nevertheless the fear of the Lord does not always protect

us from the trouble in this life. Evil things still happen

to people who love the Lord. This verse is not a universal

promise but a general guideline. It describes what would

happen if this world were sinless, what *will* happen in the

new earth, *when *faithful believers will be under God’s

protection forever.

* Pastor Sather *

*I thank You Lord, for the promise of a New Earth, for*

*all who have remained faithful to You. It is my honest *

*endeavor to remain faithful to You. . . **Amen. *
original_reflection_text:
Those who fear the Lord receive “protection from harm,”
because of their healthy habits, their beneficial lifestyle,
and sometimes through God’s direction, and intervention.
Nevertheless the fear of the Lord does not always protect
us from the trouble in this life. Evil things still happen
to people who love the Lord. This verse is not a universal
promise but a general guideline. It describes what would happen if this world were sinless, what will happen in the new earth, when faithful believers will be under God’s protection forever.
original_verse_text: Fear of the Lord give life, security, and protection  from harm.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with reverence and awe, acknowledging Your sovereign power and loving care. As Your children, we take refuge in the promise that those who fear You will lack no good thing (Psalm 34:9). Though troubles may still come our way, we trust in Your divine protection and guidance, for Your angel encamps around those who fear You (Psalm 34:7). Grant us the wisdom to walk in Your ways, that we may experience the blessings of a life lived in Your presence. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Those who fear the Lord receive “protection from harm,” because of their healthy habits, their beneficial lifestyle, and sometimes through God's direction and intervention. Nevertheless, the fear of the Lord does not always protect us from the trouble in this life. Evil things still happen to people who love the Lord. This verse is not a universal promise but a general guideline. It describes what would happen if this world were sinless, what will happen in the new earth when faithful believers will be under God's protection forever.
subject: Beneficial Life-Style
verse_text: Fear of the Lord give life, security, and protection  from harm.

*Today’s Verse:*

*A corrupt witness makes a mockery of justice; the mouth*

*of the wicked gulps down evil. *(Pro. 19:25)



*Today’s Reflection:*

There is a great difference between the person who

learns from criticism and the person who refuses to

accept correction. How we respond to criticism deter-

mines whether or not we grow in wisdom. The next

time someone criticizes you, listen carefully to all that

is said. You might learn something.

* Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, help me to accept all profit- *

*able criticism, that I may grow by it. **Amen. *
original_reflection_text:
There is a great difference between the person who
learns from criticism and the person who refuses to
accept correction. How we respond to criticism deter mines whether or not we grow in wisdom. The next
time someone criticizes you, listen carefully to all that
is said. You might learn something.
original_verse_text: A corrupt witness makes a mockery of justice; the mouth of the wicked gulps down evil.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your wisdom and guidance. Help us to have the discernment to receive correction with open minds, that we may grow in understanding and become more like Your Son. Give us the courage to learn from our mistakes and the humility to accept the wisdom of others. May we not be quick to dismiss criticism, but instead, use it as an opportunity to refine our character and deepen our relationship with You. We ask this in the name of Jesus Christ, our Lord. Amen.
reflection: There is a great difference between the person who learns from criticism and the person who refuses to accept correction. How we respond to criticism deter mines whether or not we grow in wisdom. The next time someone criticizes you, listen carefully to all that is said. You might learn something.
subject: Concerning Life and Conduct

message_id: 17bc2119eba1e044
subject   : Subject: BEING RESPONSIBLE
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 7 Sep 2021 16:02:20 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verse: *

*If you are too lazy to plow in the right season, you *

*will have no food at the harvest. *(Pro. 20:4)



*Today’s Reflection:*

You’ve heard similar warnings: If you don’t study,

you will fail the test; If you don’t save, you won’t

have money when you need it. God wants us to

anticipate future needs and prepare for them. We

can’t expect Him to come to our rescue when we

cause our own problems through lack of planning

and action. He provides for us, but He also expects

us to be responsible.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, please forgive me when*

*I lack responsibility. I pray that I will take res-*

*ponsiblity for all that is within my power. **Amen. *
original_reflection_text:
You’ve heard similar warnings: If you don’t study,
you will fail the test; If you don’t save, you won’t
have money when you need it. God wants us to
anticipate future needs and prepare for them. We
can’t expect Him to come to our rescue when we
cause our own problems through lack of planning
and action. He provides for us, but He also expects
us to be responsible.
original_verse_text: If you are too lazy to plow in the right season, you  will have no food at the harvest.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging Your wisdom and provision. Help us to heed the guidance found in Your Word, that we may not be lazy or slothful, but diligent in our work, planning for the future, and being responsible stewards of the blessings You have entrusted to us. May we labor not merely for earthly rewards, but with the understanding that we are ultimately working for You, the true Master, who will reward us with the inheritance of eternal life. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: You've heard similar warnings: If you don't study, you will fail the test; if you don't save, you won't have money when you need it. God wants us to anticipate future needs and prepare for them. We can't expect Him to come to our rescue when we cause our own problems through lack of planning and action. He provides for us, but He also expects us to be responsible.

subject   : Subject: THE NEED FOR ONGOING CLEANSING
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

===================================================================

*Today’s Verse:*

*Who can say, “I have cleansed my heart: I am pure and*

* free from sin?” *(Pro. 20:9)



*Today’s Reflection:*

*No one* is free from sin. As soon as we confess our sins

and repent, sinful thoughts and actions begin to creep

into our life. We all need *ongoing cleansing*, moment

by moment. Thank God He provides forgiveness by His

mercy when we ask for it. Make confession and repent-

ance a regular part of your talks with God. Rely on Him

moment by moment for the cleansing you need.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, Here I am again today seeking forgiveness*

*for any sins that stand between us. **Amen.*
original_reflection_text:
No one is free from sin. As soon as we confess our sins
and repent, sinful thoughts and actions begin to creep
into our life. We all need ongoing cleansing, moment
by moment. Thank God He provides forgiveness by His
mercy when we ask for it. Make confession and repent ance a regular part of your talks with God. Rely on Him
moment by moment for the cleansing you need.
original_verse_text: Who can say, "I have cleansed my heart: I am pure and free from sin?"
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that none of us are free from sin. Though we strive to walk in Your ways, we often fall short and give in to temptation. We are grateful, Lord, that You have promised forgiveness and cleansing when we confess our sins and turn to You in repentance. Help us to make confession and repentance a regular part of our lives, that we may be continually renewed by Your mercy and grace. Empower us to rely on You moment by moment, that we may be cleansed and made whole in Your sight. Amen.
reflection: No one is free from sin. As soon as we confess our sins and repent, sinful thoughts and actions begin to creep into our life. We all need ongoing cleansing, moment by moment. Thank God He provides forgiveness by His mercy when we ask for it. Make confession and repentance a regular part of your talks with God. Rely on Him moment by moment for the cleansing you need.
subject: The Need for Ongoing Cleansing
verse_text: Who can say, “I have cleansed my heart: I am pure and free from sin?”

===================================================================

*Today’s Verse:*

*The Lord despises double standards; He is not pleased *

*by dishonest scales. *(Pro 20:23)



*Today’s Reflection:*

“Dishonest scales” refers to loaded scales a merch-

ant might use in order to cheat customers. Dishonesty

is a difficult sin to avoid. It is easy to cheat if we think

no one is looking. But dishonesty affects the very core

of a person. It makes him untrustworthy, and untrusting.

It eventually makes him unable to know himself or re-

late to others. Don’t take dishonestly lightly. Even the

smalllest portion of dishonesty contains enough of the

poison of deceit to kill your spiritual life. If there is any

dishonesty in your life, tell God about it now.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, I** pray for Your forgiveness *

*if I have wounded any soul today by any false state-*

*ment** or dealings. Amen. *

Forgive us for the times we have been tempted to cheat or manipulate, and cleanse us from any dishonesty that has crept into our lives. May we be trustworthy and transparent, reflecting Your character to the world. We desire to know You and relate to others with sincerity. Lord, guide us to live with honesty and righteousness, for Your glory. Amen.

subject   : Subject: LOOKING BACK FOR UNDERSTANDING
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

===================================================================

*Today’s Verse:*

*How can we understand the road we travel? It is the *

*Lord who directs our steps. *(Prov. 20:24)



*Today’s Reflection:*

We are often confused by the events around us. Some-

things we will never understand until years later when

we look back and see how God was working. This pro

verb counsels us to not worry if we don’t understand

everything as it happens instead, we should trust that

God knows what He is doing, even if His timing or

design is not clear to us. Read Psalm 37:23 for a rea-

ssuring promise of God’s direction in our life.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I will continue*

*to follow You, trust in You, and attempt to do Your *

*will. **Amen. *

We are often confused by the events around us. Some things we will never understand until years later when
we look back and see how God was working. This pro

In the midst of life's uncertainties, we choose to trust in Your perfect plan, even when we cannot fully comprehend it. Grant us the wisdom to lean not on our own understanding, but to acknowledge You in all our ways, knowing that You will direct our paths according to Your good and gracious will. May we walk confidently, trusting that Your hand is guiding us, even when the way seems unclear. We surrender ourselves to Your sovereign purposes, Lord. Amen.

subject   : Subject: THE SERIOUSNESS OF PROMISE MAKING
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 11 Sep 2021 15:01:43 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verse:*

*It is dangerous to make a rash promises to God before *

*counting the cost. *(Pro. 20:25)



*Today’s Reflection:*

This proverb points out the danger of making a vow

rashly then reconsidering it. God takes vows seriously

and requires that they be carried out (Deut. 23:21ff).

we often have good intentions when making a vow

because we want to show God that we are determined

to please Him. Jesus, however, says it is better not to

make a promise to God because He knows how diff-

icult they are to keep (Mt. 5:33ff). If you still feel it

is important to make a vow, make sure you weigh

the consequences of breaking that cost.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, help me to always remember the warning *

*we have been given in this verse: **Amen.*

to please Him. Jesus, however, says it is better not to
make a promise to God because He knows how diff icult they are to keep (Matthew 5:33ff). If you still feel it
is important to make a vow, make sure you weigh
the consequences of breaking that cost.
original_verse_text: It is dangerous to make a rash promises to God before  counting the cost.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with reverence and humility, acknowledging the weight of the vows we make in Your presence. Help us to be mindful and discerning, not rashly committing to promises we may struggle to keep. Grant us wisdom to carefully consider the implications of our words, that we may honor You with our commitments. May our hearts be steadfast in fulfilling the vows we make, for You are a God who takes them seriously. Guide us, Lord, that we may walk in obedience and bring glory to Your name. Amen.

If you still feel it is important to make a vow, make sure you weigh the consequences of breaking that cost.

subject   : Subject: IS GOD PLEASED?

===================================================================

*Today’s Verse:*

*People may think they are doing what is right, but the*

*Lord, *examines* the heart. T*he Lord is more pleased when

we do what is just and right than when we give Him sacrifices.

(Pro. 21:2, 3).



*Today’s Reflection*

People may mistakenly think they are doing right but God sees

the motives of their hearts. We often have to make choices in

areas where the right action is difficult to figure out. We can

help ourselves make such decisions by trying to identify our

motives first and then asking, *Would-God-be-pleased-with-*

*my-real-reasons-for-doing-**this*? God *is not* pleased when we

do good deeds *only* to receive something in return.

*Pastor Sather *

*Dear Lord, I ask for Your forgiveness because I know that *

*my choices have not always been pleasing to You. **Amen.*

*Today’s Verse:*

*Good planning and hard work lead to prosperity,*

*but hasty shortcuts lead to poverty. *(Pro. 21:5)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Faithful completion of one’s work is a great accomp-

lishment. Being a diligent worker does not come naturally

to some people; *it is *the result of strong character. Don’t

look for short cuts that result in inefficiency. Work hard

as if in the service of God.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord , help me remember that all we do is *

*to be done in service to You. **Amen.*

*Today’s Verse:*

*the wise have wealth a luxury, but fools spend *

*what- ever they get. *(Pro. 21:20)



*Today’s Reflection:*

This proverb is about saving for the future. Easy

credit has people living on the edge of bankruptcy.

The desire to keep up appearances and to accum-

ulate more, drives them to spend every penny they

earn, and they stretch their credit to the limit. But

anyone who spends all he has is spending more than

he can afford. A wise person puts money aside for

hard times. God approves of foresight and restraint.

God’s people need to examine their life-style to

see whether their spending is God-pleasing or merely

self-pleasing.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, help me to do some honest*

*self-searching, and make any correction I need to*

*make. **Amen.*

May we not be driven by the pursuit of worldly possessions, but instead seek to store up treasures in heaven. Guide us to be good stewards of all that You have entrusted to us. Amen.

message_id: 17bf023eaaf79dce
subject   : Subject: YOU MAY FOOL PEOPLE BUT NOT GOD
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 16 Sep 2021 14:44:51 -0500
===================================================================

*Today’s Verse:*

*God loathes the sacrifice of an evil person, especially *

*when it is brought with ulterior motives. *(Pro. 21:27)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The kind of worship (sacrifice) described in this pro-

verb is no better than a bribe. How do people try to

bribe God? They may go to church, tithe, or volun-

teer, *not* because of their love and devotion to God

*but* because they hope God will bless them in return.

But God has made it very clear that He desires obed-

ience and love more than religious ritual (see Pro.

21:3; I Sam. 15:22). God does not want our sacrifices

of time, energy, and money alone; He wants our heart,

our complete love and devotion. We may be able to

bribe people (21:14) but we *can-not *bribe God.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that all that I give *

*is received as a loving gift to You. **Amen.*

The kind of worship (sacrifice) described in this pro verb is no better than a bribe. How do people try to
bribe God? They may go to church, tithe, or volun teer, not because of their love and devotion to God but because they hope God will bless them in return.
But God has made it very clear that He desires obed ience and love more than religious ritual (see Proverbs 21:3;
I Samuel 15:22). God does not want our sacrifices
of time, energy, and money alone; He wants our heart,
our complete love and devotion. We may be able to
bribe people (21:14) but we cannot bribe God.

original_verse_text: God loathes the sacrifice of an evil person, especially  when it is brought with ulterior motives.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, not with empty sacrifices or vain attempts to bribe You, but with hearts filled with genuine love and devotion. Forgive us for the times when our worship has been more about seeking Your blessings than seeking to honor and obey You. Help us to understand that You desire our obedience and love more than any religious ritual or outward show. May we walk humbly with You, do justice, and love mercy, as Your Word instructs. Amen.

*Today’s Verse:*

*The horses are prepared for battle, but the victory *

*belongs to the Lord *(Pro. 21:31).



*Today’s Reflection:*

This proverb refers to preparing for battle. All our

preparation for any task is useless without God.

But even with God’s help we must do our part and

prepare. His control of the outcome does not nullify

our responsibilities. God may want you to produce

a great book, but you must learn to write. God may

want to use you in foreign missions, but you must

learn the language. God will accomplish His pur-

pose, and He will use you if you have done your

part by being well prepared.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord I pray that I will always be alert to *

*Your Holy Spirit’s coaching. **Amen. *

May we never neglect our responsibilities, but rather, seek to honor You through our faithful stewardship and unwavering commitment. Lord, work in us both to will and to work for Your good pleasure. Amen.

subject   : Subject: WHERE DO UNDESERVED BLESSINGS COME FROM?
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

*Today’s Verse*

*True humility and fear of the Lord lead to riches, *

*honor, and long life. *(Pro. 22:4)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Have you ever noticed how the book of Proverbs

continually tells us how we should live? What I

have notice is that there is to be no exceptions.

Provers also contains *many* strong statements about

the benefits of wisdom, including long life, wealth,

honor, and peace. If you are not experiencing them,

does that mean you are short on wisdom?

*Not necessarily*. Instead of guarantees, these state-

ments are *general* principles. In a perfect world,

wise behavior would always lead to these benefits.

*Even *in this troubled world, living wisely usually

results in obvious blessings—*but not* always.

Sometimes sin intervenes, and some blessing must

be delayed until Jesus returns to establish His eternal

kingdom. That is why*— “We must live by believing *

*and not by** seeing.”*

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, as You know without me*

*telling You, that without faith in You we would*

*be in serious trouble, forgive us when we go about*

*the things of this world forgetting that all we have*

*we have received because of Your grace. **Amen.*

When we face trials and tribulations, grant us the discernment to lean on Your understanding, trusting that Your plans are perfect, even when we cannot see the full picture. May we live by faith, not by sight, and find our true treasure in the eternal blessings of Your kingdom. Amen.

*Today’s Verse:*

*Just as the rich rule the poor, so the borrower is *

*servant to the lender. *(Pro. 22:7)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Does that mean we should never borrow? No, *but*

it warns us never to take on a loan without care-

fully examining our ability to repay it. A loan we

can handle is enabling; a loan we cannot handle

is enslaving. The borrower must realize that

until the loan is repaid, he is a servant to the in-

dividual or institution that made it.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear lord, help us to make a careful examination *

*of what we need and what we can do without. *

*Amen.*
original_reflection_text:
Does that mean we should never borrow? No, but
it warns us never to take on a loan without care fully examining our ability to repay it. A loan we
can handle is enabling; a loan we cannot handle
is enslaving. The borrower must realize that
until the loan is repaid, he is a servant to the in dividual or institution that made it.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that all we have is a gift from Your hand. Help us to honor You with our finances, using them wisely and not becoming enslaved to debt. Grant us the wisdom to carefully consider our ability to repay any loans, that we may not become servants to the lender, but instead be good stewards of the resources You have entrusted to us. May we seek to glorify You in all our financial decisions. Amen.

*Today’s Verse:*

*The Lord-preserves knowledge, but He ruins the plans *

*of the deceitful. *(Pro. 22:12)



*Today’s Reflection:*

“Knowledge” refers to those who have knowledge,

(that is) those who live right and speak the truth. It

takes discipline, determination, and hard work to

live God’s way, but God protects and rewards those

who make the commitment to follow. The unfaithful

may seem to have an easier time of it, *but* in the long

run their plans fail and their lives amount to nothing.

Don’t resist God and expect lasting success.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would always *

*seek to follow the path You have set for us. **Amen.*

May we not resist Your will, but find lasting success in submitting to Your perfect plan. In Jesus' name, Amen.

*Today’s Verse:*

*A lazy person is full of excuses, saying, “If I go outside, *

*I might meet a lion in the street and be killed. *(Pro. 22:13)



*Today’s Reflection:*

What we see in this proverb is, an excuse a lazy person might

use to avoid going to work. To me this excuse is truly ridiculous

*if* you live in northern Minnesota*. *Yes the excuse sounds silly to

us, *but *that’s how our excuses may sound to outers. Let us not

rationalize laziness. Let us take our responsibilities seriously and

get to work. Let us never be lazy but let us serve to Lord enthusiastic-

ally*.*

* Pastor Sather*

* Dear heavenly father, please forgive me when I use*

*the excuse, “I can’t,” because all things are possible*

*with our hand in yours. **Amen.*

Grant us the wisdom to avoid foolish excuses and the strength to be fervent in spirit, serving the Lord. Amen.

*Today’s Verse:*

*A youngster’s heart is filled with foolishness, but*

*discipline will drive it away. *(Pro. 22:15)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Young kids usually do foolish and dangerous things

simply because they don’t understand the consequences.

Wisdom and common sense are not transferred by a

parent’s good example alone. Just as God trains and

corrects us to make us better, so parents must discipline

their children to help them learn the difference between

right and wrong. To see how God corrects us, read

Proverbs 3:11, 12.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, forgive us for not doing the *

*best we could have done. Help us to do a better job*

*with our grandchildren. **Amen.*

May we have the patience and understanding to correct their foolish ways, that they may grow in righteousness and come to know the depth of Your love. In Jesus' name, Amen.

from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 23 Sep 2021 16:22:18 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verses:*

*Do not rob the poor because they are poor or exploit *

*the needy in court. For the Lord is their defender. He *

*will injure anyone who injures them. *(Pro. 22:22, 23)



*Today’s Reflection:*

These verses are a message of hope to people who must work

under unjust domineering leaders. It is also a warning to those

who enjoy ruling with an iron hand. Sometimes God intervenes

and directly destroys tyrants. More often though He uses other

rulers to overthrow them or their own oppressed people to rebel

against them. If you are in a position of authority in church, work,

or home, remember what happens to tyrants. Leadership through kindness is
more effective and longer lasting than leadership by force.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, help me remember that if I ever come into some role *

*of authority, You will remind me that You are truly our leader. *

*Amen. *

Sometimes God intervenes and directly destroys tyrants. More often though He uses other rulers to overthrow them or their own oppressed people to rebel against them. If you are in a position of authority in church, work, or home, remember what happens to tyrants. Leadership through kindness is more effective and longer lasting than leadership by force.
original_verse_text: Do not rob the poor because they are poor or exploit  the needy in court. For the Lord is their defender. He  will injure anyone who injures them.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your wisdom and guidance. We lift up those who suffer under unjust and oppressive leaders, asking that You would intervene and bring about Your justice. May those in positions of authority lead with kindness and compassion, remembering that they will be held accountable for their actions. Lord, help us to be instruments of Your love, extending mercy and grace to all. We trust in Your sovereign plan, knowing that You will ultimately triumph over evil. In Your holy name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: These verses are a message of hope to people who must work under unjust, domineering leaders. It is also a warning to those who enjoy ruling with an iron hand. Sometimes God intervenes and directly destroys tyrants. More often, though, He uses other rulers to overthrow them or their own oppressed people to rebel against them. If you are in a position of authority in church, work, or home, remember what happens to tyrants. Leadership through kindness is more effective and longer-lasting than leadership by force.
subject: Leading by Example

subject   : Subject: ALWAYS SEEK GOD'S APPROVAL
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

===================================================================

*Today’s Verses:*

*Keep away from angry, short-tempered people, or *

*you will learn to be like them and endanger your*

* soul. *(Pro. 22:24, 25).



*Today’s Reflection:*

People tend to become like those with whom they

spend a lot of time with. Even the negative character-

ristics sometimes rub off. The Bible exhorts us to be

cautious in our choice of companions. The Bible also

tells us we should choose people with characteristics

we would like to develop in our own life.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, give me the wisdom to select *

*my companions carefully. **Amen. *
original_reflection_text:
People tend to become like those with whom they
spend a lot of time with. Even the negative character ristics sometimes rub off. The Bible exhorts us to be cautious in our choice of companions.
The Bible also
tells us we should choose people with characteristics
we would like to develop in our own life.
original_verse_text: Keep away from angry, short-tempered people, or  you will learn to be like them and endanger your soul.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging the wisdom of Your Word. Help us to be discerning in our choice of companions, for as Proverbs 13:20 reminds us, “Whoever walks with the wise becomes wise, but the companion of fools will suffer harm.” Lord, grant us the wisdom to surround ourselves with those who will encourage us to grow in godliness, and to avoid those whose negative influences could lead us astray. May our relationships reflect Your desire for us to become more like You. We ask this in the name of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: People tend to become like those with whom they spend a lot of time with. Even the negative characteristics sometimes rub off. The Bible exhorts us to be cautious in our choice of companions. The Bible also tells us we should choose people with characteristics we would like to develop in our own life.
subject: Always Seek God's Approval
verse_text: Keep away from angry, short-tempered people, or  you will learn to be like them and endanger your soul.

* put before you. If you are a big eater put a knife to *

*your throat, and don’t desire all the delicacies—*

*deception** may be involved. *(Pro. 23:1-3).



*Today’s Reflection:*

A man is DECEIVED if he is a hearer of the

Word and not a doer (Jm. 1:22)

A man is DECEIVED if he says he has no

sin (I Jn. 1:8)

A man is DECEIVED when he thinks him-

self to be something when he is nothing (Gal. 6:3)

A man is DECEIVED when he thinks himself

to be wise with worldly wisdom (I Cor 3:18)

A man is DECEIVED when he seems to be

religious and does not bridle his tongue. (Jm. 1:26)

A man is DECEIVED when he thinks thathe

will not reap what he sows ((Gal. 6:11)

A man is DECEIVED when he thinks that evil company will
not corrupt good morals (I Cor. 15:33)

A man is DECEIVED when he thinks that the unrighteousness
will inherit the kingdom of God (heaven) (I Cor.
6:9)

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, when Satan tries to deceive me help me*

*to not pay attention to the above verses. With faith *

*in You all things are possible. **Amen.*

*Today’s Verses:*

*Don’t worry yourself trying to get rich. Why waste*

* your time? For riches can disappear as though they*

* had the wings of a bird! *(Pro. 23:4, 5)



*Today’s Reflection:*

I think that we have all heard of people who have

millions of dollars and then lost everything. Even

the average person can spend an inheritance—or

a paycheck—with lighting speed and have little to

show for it. Don’t spend your time chasing fleeting

earthly treasures. Instead, store up treasure in heaven,

for such treasures will never be lost. (read Lk. 12:33,

34 for Jesus’ teaching.)

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, as I think of myself and others who*

*claim Christ as their Savior I Pray that each of *

*us would refuse to let the world squeeze us into *

*its mold, and refuse to imitate it as it seeks every-*

*thing to live with and nothing to live for. **Amen. *
original_reflection_text:
I think that we have all heard of people who have
millions of dollars and then lost everything. Even
the average person can spend an inheritance-or a paycheck-with lighting speed and have little to
show for it. Don’t spend your time chasing fleeting
earthly treasures. Instead, store up treasure in heaven,
for such treasures will never be lost. (read Luke 12:33,
34 for Jesus’ teaching.)
original_subject: DOES GOD'S LOVE TOUCH YOUR WALLET?
original_verse_text: Don’t worry yourself trying to get rich. Why waste your time? For riches can disappear as though they had the wings of a bird!
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging the fleeting nature of earthly treasures. Help us to resist the temptation to chase after possessions that will ultimately fade away. Instead, guide us to store up treasures in heaven, where they will never be lost or destroyed. May our hearts be fixed on the eternal riches that You offer, for they are the true and lasting wealth. We ask this in the name of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: I think that we have all heard of people who have millions of dollars and then lost everything. Even the average person can spend an inheritance or a paycheck with lightning speed and have little to show for it. Don't spend your time chasing fleeting earthly treasures. Instead, store up treasure in heaven, for such treasures will never be lost. (read Luke 12:33, 34 for Jesus' teaching.)

===================================================================

*Today’s Verse:*

*Commit yourself to instruction; attune your ears to *

*hear words of knowledge. *(Pro. 23:12)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The people most likely to gain knowledge are those

who are willing to listen. It is a good sign of strength,

not weakness, to pay attention to what others have to

say. People who are eager to listen continue to learn

and grow throughout their lives. If we refuse to be-

come set in our ways, we can always expand the

limits of our knowledge.

* Pastor Sather*



*Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always pay atten-*

*tion to the words of those who are wiser than I. Help *
*me to also apply my heart to Your instruction. Amen.*
original_reflection_text:
The people most likely to gain knowledge are those
who are willing to listen. It is a good sign of strength,
not weakness, to pay attention to what others have to
say.
People who are eager to listen continue to learn
and grow throughout their lives. If we refuse to be come set in our ways, we can always expand the
limits of our knowledge.
original_verse_text: Commit yourself to instruction; attune your ears to  hear words of knowledge.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to grow in wisdom and understanding. Help us to be quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to become angry, as Your servant James instructs us. May we have the strength to set aside our preconceptions and be receptive to the insights and perspectives of others. Guide us to be lifelong learners, ever expanding the limits of our knowledge and drawing closer to You. In Your Son's name we pray, Amen.
reflection: The people most likely to gain knowledge are those who are willing to listen. It is a good sign of strength, not weakness, to pay attention to what others have to say. People who are eager to listen continue to learn and grow throughout their lives. If we refuse to become set in our ways, we can always expand the limits of our knowledge.
subject: Being Attentive to the Wise
verse_text: Commit yourself to instruction; attune your ears to  hear words of knowledge.

*Today’s Verses;*

*Don’t fail to correct your children. They won’t die if*

* you spank them. Physical discipline may well save *

*them from death. My child, how I will rejoice if you *

*become wise. Yes, my heart will thrill when you speak *

*what is right. *(Pro. 23: 12-16)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The stern tone of discipline here is offset by the affect-

tion expressed in verse 15 and 16. However, many par-

ents are reluctant to discipline their children at all. Some

fear that they will forfeit their relationship, afraid their

children will leave them, or they will resent them, or they

will stifle their children’s development. But correction

won’t kill children, and it may prevent them from foolish

moves that *will*.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, I thank You for my parent’s concern that I *

*would learn the important things needed to live a Chris- *

*tian life. **Amen.*

Help us to receive correction with humility, knowing that it is for our good and the good of those we love. Grant us the wisdom to discipline our children with gentleness and compassion, that they may grow in wisdom and understanding. May our homes be filled with the affection and joy that comes from walking in Your ways. We trust in Your perfect plan for our lives. Amen.

subject   : Subject: CONTINUE IN THE FEAR OF THE LORD
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 29 Sep 2021 16:35:29 -0500
===================================================================

* TODAY’S VERSES:*

*Don’t envy sinners, but always continue to fear the*

* Lord. For surely you have a future ahead of you; your*

* hope will not be disappointed. *(Pro. 23:17, 18)



*Today’s Reflection:*

How easy it is to envy those who get ahead, unhampered

by responsibility to God’s laws. For a time they do seem

to prosper without paying any attention to what God

wants, *but* they have no future. To those who follow

Him, God promises a hope and a wonderful future, even

if they do not realize it in this life.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, I pray that I would always follow your path *

*and not be concerned about what the wicked have accumulated. *

*Amen. *
original_reflection_text:
How easy it is to envy those who get ahead, unhampered by responsibility to God’s laws. For a time they do seem
to prosper without paying any attention to what God
wants, but they have no future. To those who follow
Him, God promises a hope and a wonderful future, even
if they do not realize it in this life.
original_subject: CONTINUE IN THE FEAR OF THE LORD
original_verse_text: Don’t envy sinners, but always continue to fear the Lord. For surely you have a future ahead of you; your hope will not be disappointed.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we confess that at times we are tempted to envy the prosperity of the wicked, who seem to flourish without regard for Your ways. Yet, we know that their success is fleeting, and their future is bleak. Help us to keep our hearts and minds fixed on You, for You are always with us, guiding and sustaining us. Grant us the wisdom to trust in Your plan, and the hope of a wonderful future that awaits those who follow You. May we find our true joy and security in Your presence, now and forevermore. Amen.
reflection: How easy it is to envy those who get ahead, unhampered by responsibility to God's laws. For a time, they do seem to prosper without paying any attention to what God wants, but they have no future. To those who follow Him, God promises a hope and a wonderful future, even if they do not realize it in this life.

*Today’s Verses:*

*Who hath woe? Who hath sorrow? Who hath contention? *

*Who hath babbling? Who hath wounds without cause? *

*Who hath redness of eyes? They that tarry long at the *

*wine; they that go to seek mixed wine. *(Pro. 23:29, 30)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The soothing comfort of alcohol is only temporary.

*Real* relief comes from dealing with the cause of

anguish and sorrow and turning to God for peace. Don’t

lose yourself in alcohol, instead find yourself in God.

*Pastor Sather*

*I thank You O Lord that I have never had the problem *

*spoken about in these verse. Help me to remember the *

*families who have some one who does. Amen.*
original_reflection_text:
The soothing comfort of alcohol is only temporary. Real relief comes from dealing with the cause of
anguish and sorrow and turning to God for peace. Don’t
lose yourself in alcohol, instead find yourself in God.
original_verse_text:
Who hath woe? Who hath sorrow? Who hath contention?  Who hath babbling? Who hath wounds without cause?  Who hath redness of eyes? They that tarry long at the  wine;
they that go to seek mixed wine.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in our moments of anguish and sorrow, seeking true comfort and peace. Help us to resist the fleeting allure of alcohol, which only masks the deeper issues we face. Instead, lead us to find our solace in You, the source of everlasting joy and strength. May we turn to Your Word and Your presence, that we may be filled with Your Spirit and find the healing and restoration our souls so desperately need. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: The soothing comfort of alcohol is only temporary. Real relief comes from dealing with the cause of anguish and sorrow and turning to God for peace. Don't lose yourself in alcohol; instead, find yourself in God.
